definitions.definition: To incur , stand, or bear without serious detriment, as an act which might under other circumstances be injurious; ( usually after an expression of ability, as could , able , difficult ) to be able or rich enough; to spare.
examples: I think we can afford the extra hour it will take.  We can only afford to buy a small car at the moment.

definitions.definition: To offer , provide , or supply , as in selling, granting or expending, with profit, or without too great a loss.
examples: Alfred affords his goods cheaper than Bantock.

definitions.definition: To give forth; to supply , yield , or produce as the natural result, fruit, or issue .
examples: Grapes afford wine.  Olives afford oil.  The earth affords fruit.  The sea affords an abundant supply of fish.

definitions.definition: To give , grant , or confer , with a remoter reference to its being the natural result; to provide; to furnish .
examples: A good life affords consolation in old age.

main_definition: To incur , stand, or bear without serious detriment, as an act which might under other circumstances be injurious; ( usually after an expression of ability, as could , able , difficult ) to be able or rich enough; to spare.
secondary_definitions: ( obsolete ) To offer , provide , or supply , as in selling, granting or expending, with profit, or without too great a loss.
(rare) To give forth; to supply , yield , or produce as the natural result, fruit, or issue .
To give , grant , or confer , with a remoter reference to its being the natural result; to provide; to furnish .
